title: Welcome to BIOL2022
text:
Thank you for joining Biology Experimental Design and Analysis, also known as BEDA (üêù-da). This Unit aims to help you learn the core skills in biology that underpins how research is designed, analysed and interpreted. Click on the links below for more information.

title: BIOL2022 Unit Handbook

Thank you for joining Biology Experimental Design and Analysis, also known as BEDA (üêù-da). This Unit aims to help you learn the core skills in biology that underpins how research is designed, analysed and interpreted. Click on the links below for more information.

















Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Januar (Unit Coordinator), Clare (Lecturer) and Mat (Lecturer).

title: Preface
text:
Many students think of BEDA as yet another statistics unit. This is not quite true. Unlike most other statistical units, BEDA focuses on the practical aspects of data analysis. We assume that you already have a basic understanding of statistical concepts, and we build on that knowledge, focusing on the how and why of statistical methods:

How do we design a good study?
Why does study design make a difference in the results we get?
Why is it important to understand the context in which we use statistical tests?

Importantly, attending labs is crucial to your learning as most of the data we use are collected by you ‚Äì please do not skip any of them!
